com.bigdata.rdf.task

Interface IApiTask<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Callable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractApiTask, AbstractDelegateRestApiTask, AbstractRestApiTask, CreateKBTask, DestroyKBTask

    public interface IApiTask<T>
extends Callable<T>
    A task that can be run either with direct index access or using the concurrency manager (compatible with group commit).
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    Concurrent unisolated operations against multiple KBs

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IIndexManager getIndexManager()
      Return the IIndexManager.
      String getNamespace()
      The namespace of the target KB instance.
      long getTimestamp()
      The timestamp of the view of that KB instance.
      boolean isGRSRequired()
      Tasks that create or destroy locatable resources need to write on the global row store (GRS).
      void setIndexManager(IIndexManager indexManager)
      Invoked to inform the task of the index manager before it is executed.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.Callable

        call

    • Method Detail

      • getNamespace

        String getNamespace()
        The namespace of the target KB instance.

      • getTimestamp

        long getTimestamp()
        The timestamp of the view of that KB instance.

      • isGRSRequired

        boolean isGRSRequired()
        Tasks that create or destroy locatable resources need to write on the global row store (GRS). Such tasks must specify this property. Note that the GRS lock will have the side-effect of serializing all such tasks that write on the GRS index.

      • setIndexManager

        void setIndexManager(IIndexManager indexManager)
        Invoked to inform the task of the index manager before it is executed.
        Parameters:
        indexManager - The index manager.

      • getIndexManager

        IIndexManager getIndexManager()
        Return the IIndexManager.
        Returns:
        The index manager.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the IIndexManager reference is not set.
